title: Police arrest suspect in quadruple shooting in NE Baltimore
content:
BALTIMORE —
A 20-year-old-man has been arrested in connection with a quadruple shooting Thursday in northeast Baltimore.
City police said Stephon Carroll, of the 6000 block of Walther Avenue, is charged with four counts of attempted murder. He is now at Central Booking and waiting to see a court commissioner, police said.
Four people, including a 12- and a 16-year-old, were shot Thursday in the shooting in the 4800 block of Frankford Avenue, police said.
The victims' ages range from 12 to 33 years old.
When officers arrived at the scene, they found the four victims suffering from non-life-threatening injuries.
Witnesses told police that the victims were attending a gathering on Frankfort Avenue when gunfire erupted.
According to detectives, this shooting incident occurred as the direct result of an ongoing neighborhood dispute.
Multiple agencies, including the Baltimore City Fire Department, responded to help treat those who were injured.
The male victims are 33, 18, 16 and 12 years old.
Anyone with information in the case is asked to call police at 410-396-2221.
